means: （潜水员过快浮出水面造成的）减压病

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"弯，弯曲"之意。
means: curve ： 指变成曲线或弧线状的动作或状态。
bend ： 普通用词，指把某物变成曲线或角形。用于人时，指头部或身躯弯下。
bow ： 指把头部或上身弯向前方的动作，也指社交中的礼节性动作。
crook ： 指不规则的弯曲，也指按照规则或模型弯曲某物。
twist ： 指通过转动、拧或扭使某物成弯曲状。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两动词均可表示"弯腰，弯曲"之意。
means: stoop ： 通常用于人，指屈膝降低身体高度或低头弯腰。常引申作屈从或不顾尊严。
bend ： 指人指物皆可，含义广，指任何弯曲的动作。可引申作屈从解。

sentence.Network_en: I rounded a bend where the trees and brush grew thickly.
sentence.Network_cn: 我绕过一个林木茂盛的弯。

sentence.Network_en: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.
sentence.Network_cn: 少数官员准备篡改规则。

sentence.Network_en: The driver failed to negotiate a bend and ran into a tree.
sentence.Network_cn: 司机没能顺利拐弯，撞到了树上。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)talk to someone, especially with great eagerness or in order to ask a favour
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（尤指迫切地或为了请求帮助而）喋喋不休地缠住某人，与某人纠缠

lj.lj_ls: 一个再也不愿向外国列强屈服的国家。

lj.lj_ls: 一个再也不愿向外国列强屈服的国家。

lj.lj_ls: 这事以前老是让我妻子发疯。

jx.jx_en_mean: To talk to at length, usually excessively.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 谈论不休：长时间地交谈，通常是过分详细地谈论

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bendan 'put in bonds, tension a bow by means of a string', of Germanic origin; related to band
late Middle English : from Anglo-Norman French bande, Old French bende 'flat strip'

entry.def: When you bend, you move the top part of your body downwards and forwards. Plants and trees also bend .

example.ex: I bent over and kissed her cheek...
example.tran: 我俯身亲吻了她的脸颊。

example.ex: Turn the pot if the plants show signs of bending towards the light...
example.tran: 如果花草有向阳性，就把花盆转一下。

entry.def: When you bend your head, you move your head forwards and downwards.

example.ex: Rick appeared, bending his head a little to clear the top of the door.
example.tran: 里克到了，进门时为了避开门楣稍微低了下头。

entry.tran: 弯曲（手臂、腿等）；（手臂、腿等）弯曲
entry.def: When you bend a part of your body such as your arm or leg, or when it bends, you change its position so that it is no longer straight.

example.ex: These cruel devices are designed to stop prisoners bending their legs...
example.tran: 这些残酷的刑具是用来阻止犯人弯腿的。

example.ex: As you walk faster, you will find the arms bend naturally and more quickly.
example.tran: 走快时，你会发现手臂会自然弯曲，而且频率会更快。

entry.def: If you bend something that is flat or straight, you use force to make it curved or to put an angle in it.

example.ex: Bend the bar into a horseshoe...
She'd cut a jagged hole in the tin, bending a knife in the process.
example.tran: 她在罐头上曲里拐弯地划了个口，其间还弄弯了一把小刀。

entry.def: When a road, beam of light, or other long thin thing bends, or when something bends it, it changes direction to form a curve or angle.

example.ex: The road bent slightly to the right...
Glass bends light of different colours by different amounts.
example.tran: 玻璃对不同颜色的光的折射量不同。

entry.def: A bend in a road, pipe, or other long thin object is a curve or angle in it.

example.ex: The crash occurred on a sharp bend.
example.tran: 撞车发生在一个急转弯处。

example.ex: ...an historic town nestling in a bend of the river.
example.tran: 一个坐落在河曲处的历史名镇

entry.def: If someone bends to your wishes, they believe or do something different, usually when they do not want to.

example.ex: Congress has to bend to his will...
example.tran: 国会不得不屈从于他的意志。

example.ex: Do you think she's likely to bend on her attitude to Europe?
example.tran: 你认为她会改变对欧洲的态度吗？

entry.tran: 曲解，通融，篡改（规则、法律等）
entry.def: If you bend rules or laws, you interpret them in a way that allows you to do something they would not normally allow you to do.

example.ex: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.
example.tran: 少数官员准备篡改规则。

entry.def: If you bend the truth or bend the facts, you say something that is not exactly true.

example.ex: Sometimes we bend the truth a little in order to spare them the pain of the real facts.
example.tran: 有时我们会稍微变动一下事实，以免他们知道实情会太痛苦。

entry.def: If you say that someone is bending over backwards to be helpful or kind, you are emphasizing that they are trying very hard to be helpful or kind.

example.ex: People are bending over backwards to please customers.
example.tran: 人们正使出浑身解数取悦顾客。

entry.tran: 使非常恼火；使极为恼怒
entry.def: If you say that someone or something drives you round the bend, you mean that you dislike them and they annoy or upset you very much.

example.ex: And can you make that tea before your fidgeting drives me completely round the bend.
example.tran: 你能不能把那壶茶泡好？瞧你坐立不安的样子，真要把我惹急了。

entry.def: If you say that someone is round the bend, you mean that they do foolish or silly things.

example.ex: People thought I was round the bend.

means.word_mean: 1. a circular segment of a curve;
2. movement that causes the formation of a curve
3. curved segment (of a road or river or railroad track etc.)
4. an angular or rounded shape made by folding;
5. diagonal line traversing a shield from the upper right corner to the lower left
3. cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form;

sentences.sentence: "the strong man could turn an iron bar"

means.word_mean: 4. bend one's back forward from the waist on down;

sentences.sentence: "The young man stooped to pick up the girl's purse"

means.word_mean: 5. turn from a straight course , fixed direction, or line of interest

example.en: He bent the throttle at ninety.
example.zh: 他以 90 码的速度高速驾车。

auth_sentence.content: Our way is always to bend with the wind.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our way is always to bend with the wind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our way is always to bend with the wind.

auth_sentence.content: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?
auth_sentence.res_content: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?

auth_sentence.content: Her treading would not bend a blade of grasse!
auth_sentence.res_content: Her treading would not bend a blade of grasse!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her treading would not bend a blade of grasse!

Sentence.sentence: Extravagance (奢侈) is out Business folk are bending over backwards to avoid seeming extravagant.

sentences.en: The branch bent but did not break.
sentences.cn: 那树枝弯曲, 但没有折断。
